intro: Stemmadenia, commonly known as the African star grass, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The leaves are usually opposite, simple, and have a slightly rough texture. The plant is native to various regions in Africa and is often found in grasslands and woodland areas. It plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
